result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie L. Napientek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
Minus $500.00 bond on deposit.
Balance to be worked out on payment plan with agent.
Balance to be worked out on payment plan with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Take substances according to Dr.'s orders.  Must be approved by agent.
No contact with T.B.
Complete any assessments, counseling and follow through treatment as recommended by agent.

Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
May serve in Dickinson County.
